meta.name: generator
meta.content: HTML Tidy for Windows (vers 25 March 2009), see www.w3.org

div.p: Plugin Version @PLUGIN_VERSION@

AppHarbor is a cloud platform as a service or PaaS, that supports applications running on the .NET Framework. AppHarbor allows to deploy and scale .NET applications without limiting the versioning tool and allows the installation of add-ons in a simple way. Among AppHarbor most common uses are to host blogs, web sites and high traffic web applications.
The list of available resources on App Harbor is formed by:
More information can be found at:

The @PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin is open, it allows the input of many AppHarbor functions defined in the provided fields of the parameters. Is important to provide all the parameters required for the correct functioning of the AppHarbor plugin.

ElectricFlow itself provides some advantages like parameters checking, easy functionality selection using only check boxes or radio buttons, hitorical log reports, procedure duration statistics, simple credentials attachment, real time analysis of the log been generated, among others.
IMPORTANT: For all parameter descriptions below, required parameters are shown in bold italics.
This procedure allows to list all applications associated with the authorized AppHarbor account, or just one specific application.

Some of the parameters are not required for all cases, however, the "required" specified fields cannot be omited. The parameters that are not required for all cases are only displayed depending the value of Action parameter.

tr.td: The name of the configuration that contains the information to connect with AppHarbor.(Required)
Select the Action to perform, the options are: List All and Get application detail.(Required)
The globally unique, URL-friendly version of the application name.

div.p: List Applications parameters form:
This procedure allows to create an AppHarbor application.
The "required" specified fields cannot be omited.

tr.td: The name of the configuration that contains the information to connect with AppHarbor.(Required)
Specifies the name for the app to create.(Required)
Select the region identifier, the options are: amazon-web-services::us-east-1 or amazon-web-services::eu-west-1.(Required)

div.p: Create Application parameters form:
This procedure allows to edit an existing AppHarbor application.
The "required" specified fields cannot be omited.

tr.td: The name of the configuration that contains the information to connect with AppHarbor.(Required)
The globally unique, URL-friendly version of the application name.(Required)
Specifies the new name for the app.(Required)

div.p: Edit Application parameters form:
This procedure allows to remove an existing AppHarbor application.
The "required" specified fields cannot be omited.

tr.td: The name of the configuration that contains the information to connect with AppHarbor.(Required)
The globally unique, URL-friendly version of the application name.(Required)

div.p: Remove Application parameters form:
This procedure allows to retrieve information about the unhandled exception logs for an application.

Some of the parameters are not required for all cases, however, the "required" specified fields cannot be omited. The parameters that are not required for all cases are only displayed depending the value of Action parameter.

tr.td: The name of the configuration that contains the information to connect with AppHarbor.(Required)
Select the Action to perform, the options are: List Error Logs and Get Error Detail. (Required)
The globally unique, URL-friendly version of the application name. (Required)

div.p: List Errors parameters form:
Used to retrieve information about the collaborators for an application.

Some of the parameters are not required for all cases, however, the "required" specified fields cannot be omited. The parameters that are not required for all cases are only displayed depending the value of Action parameter.

tr.td: The name of the configuration that contains the information to connect with AppHarbor. (Required)
Select the Action to perform, the options are: List Collaborators and Get Collaborator Detail. (Required)
The globally unique, URL-friendly version of the application name. (Required)

div.p: List Collaborator parameters form:
This procedure allows to create a collaborator for an application.
The "required" specified fields cannot be omited.

tr.td: The name of the configuration that contains the information to connect with AppHarbor.(Required)
The globally unique, URL-friendly version of the application name.(Required)
The email address of the collaborator to add. (Required)
The access level for the collaborator. Accepted values are collaborator or administrator. (Required)

div.p: Create Collaborator parameters form:
Allows to edit an existing collaborator for an application.
The "required" specified fields cannot be omited.

tr.td: The name of the configuration that contains the information to connect with AppHarbor.(Required)
The globally unique, URL-friendly version of the application name.(Required)
The access level for the collaborator. Accepted values are collaborator or administrator. (Required)

div.p: Edit Collaborator parameters form:
Allows to remove an existing collaborator from an application.
The "required" specified fields cannot be omited.

tr.td: The name of the configuration that contains the information to connect with AppHarbor.(Required)
The globally unique, URL-friendly version of the application name.(Required)

div.p: Remove Collaborator parameters form:
Allows the developer to retrieve information about the user-created environment settings for an application. The options are: List Configuration Variables and Get Configuration Variable Detail

Some of the parameters are not required for all cases, however, the "required" specified fields cannot be omited. The parameters that are not required for all cases are only displayed depending the value of Action parameter.

tr.td: The name of the configuration that contains the information to connect with AppHarbor.(Required)
Select the Action to perform, the options are: List Configuration Variables and Get Configuration Variable Detail. (Required)
The globally unique, URL-friendly version of the application name. (Required)

div.p: List Configuration parameters form:
Allows the user to create a configuration variable for an application.
The "required" specified fields cannot be omited.

tr.td: The name of the configuration that contains the information to connect with AppHarbor.(Required)
The globally unique, URL-friendly version of the application name.(Required)
The name of the configuration variable.(Required)
The value to assign to the configuration variable.(Required)

div.p: Create Configuration Variable parameters form:
Allows the user to edit a configuration variable for an application.
The "required" specified fields cannot be omited.

tr.td: The name of the configuration that contains the information to connect with AppHarbor.(Required)
The globally unique, URL-friendly version of the application name.(Required)
The name of the configuration variable.(Required)
The value to assign to the configuration variable.(Required)

div.p: Edit Configuration Variable parameters form:
This procedure is used to remove a configuration variable from an application.
The "required" specified fields cannot be omited.

tr.td: The name of the configuration that contains the information to connect with AppHarbor.(Required)
The globally unique, URL-friendly version of the application name.(Required)

div.p: Remove Configuration Variable parameters form:
Allow the user to create, view and modify the custom hostnames and domains associated with an application.

Some of the parameters are not required for all cases, however, the "required" specified fields cannot be omited. The parameters that are not required for all cases are only displayed depending the value of Action parameter.

tr.td: The name of the configuration that contains the information to connect with AppHarbor. (Required)
Select the Action to perform, the options are: List Hostnames and Get Hostname Detail. (Required)
The globally unique, URL-friendly version of the application name. (Required)

div.p: List Host Names parameters form:
Allow the user to create a custom host name and associate it with an application. IMPORTANT: Adding hostnames to an application incurs a cost.
The "required" specified fields cannot be omited.

tr.td: The name of the configuration that contains the information to connect with AppHarbor. (Required)
The globally unique, URL-friendly version of the application name. (Required)

div.p: Create Host Name parameters form:
Allow the user to delete a host name from a given application.
The "required" specified fields cannot be omited.

tr.td: The name of the configuration that contains the information to connect with AppHarbor. (Required)
The globally unique, URL-friendly version of the application name. (Required)

div.p: Delete Host Name parameters form:
This procedure is used to view the service hooks associated with an AppHarbor application.

Some of the parameters are not required for all cases, however, the "required" specified fields cannot be omited. The parameters that are not required for all cases are only displayed depending the value of Action parameter.

tr.td: The name of the configuration that contains the information to connect with AppHarbor.(Required)
Select the Action to perform, the options are: List Service Hooks and Get Service Hook Detail. (Required)
The globally unique, URL-friendly version of the application name. (Required)

div.p: List Service Hooks parameters form for the "scale" action:
Allows the user to create service hooks and associate them with an AppHarbor application.
The "required" specified fields cannot be omited.

tr.td: The name of the configuration that contains the information to connect with AppHarbor.(Required)
The globally unique, URL-friendly version of the application name. (Required)

div.p: Create Service Hook parameters form for the "scale" action:
This procedure is used to remove service hooks associated with an AppHarbor application.
The "required" specified fields cannot be omited.

tr.td: The name of the configuration that contains the information to connect with AppHarbor.(Required)
The globally unique, URL-friendly version of the application name. (Required)

div.p: Remove Service Hook parameters form:

Allow the user to retrieve information about the build history for an application. This procedure will permit the viewing the test history associated with the authorized AppHarbor account. The options provided are: List Build History, Get Build Detail, List Tests and Get Test Detail.

Some of the parameters are not required for all cases, however, the "required" specified fields cannot be omited. The parameters that are not required for all cases are only displayed depending the value of Action parameter.

tr.td: The name of the configuration that contains the information to connect with AppHarbor.(Required)
Select the Action to perform, the options are: List Build History, Get Build Detail, List Tests and Get Test Detail. (Required)
The globally unique, URL-friendly version of the application name. (Required)

div.p: Builds Actions parameters form:
Allow the user to deploy an application. The editor for this subprocedure will have the following parameters:

tr.td: The name of the configuration that contains the information to connect with AppHarbor.(Required)
The globally unique, URL-friendly version of the application name. (Required)

div.p: Deploy parameters form:
Allows the user to create a Configuration with the valid token, by providing the username and password. IMPORTANT: This procedure can be used only on Windows.

tr.td: Provide a name for the configuration to be created.(Required)
The valid username for the AppHarbor account. (Required)
The valid password for the AppHarbor account. (Required)

div.p: Retrieve Token parameters form:

div.h2: Example: Create Application, List Collaborator, Create Configuration Variable, List Host Names and Remove Application.
div.p: The first step is to create a configuration with your AppHarbor API Key, wich is available by following the steps in the OAuth v2 page, Authorization Workflow.

With the configuration ready, it is possible to use any of the procedures provided. For this example we will start by creating a new AppHarbor App, in order to do this it is necesary to access the Create Application procedure and provide the requested parameters:
Once the parameters are set, now you are able to execute the step. The result is succesful:
To continue with the example, it is possible to list Collaborators of an Application by entering the List Collaborator procedure and provide the required parameters:
Once the parameters are set, now you are able to execute the step. The result is succesful:
For this case it is also possible to check the response from AppHarbor by entering the log:

An important funcitionality used in the example includes the configuration variables operations, in this case a new configuration variable will be created for the application created earlier. It is necesary to access the Create Configuration Variable procedure and provide the requested parameters:
Once the parameters are set, now you are able to execute the step. The result is succesful:
It is also possible to check the response body from AppHarbor by entering the log:

To continue with the example, now it is time to review the Host Names for the application, in order to make this happen, the user must access the List Host Names procedure and provide the required parameters:
Once the parameters are set, now you are able to execute the step. The result is succesful:
It is also possible to check the response body from AppHarbor by entering the log:
As final action for thi example the application will be destroyed using the procedure Remove Application. It is necesary to provide the following parameters:
Once the parameters are set, now you are able to execute the step. The result is succesful:
It is also possible to check the response body from AppHarbor by entering the log, in this case the action was destroy, and for that the response body is empty:

ul.li: Fixed issue with configurations being cached for IE.

Procedures: List Applications, Create Application, Edit Application, Remove Application, List Errors, List Collaborator, Create Collaborator, Edit Collaborator, Remove Collaborator, List Configuration, Create Configuration Variable, Edit Configuration Variable, Remove Configuration Variable, List Host Names, Create Host Name, Delete Host Name, List Service Hooks, Create Service Hook, Remove Service Hook, Builds Actions, Retrieve Token and Deploy.
Implemented dynamic GWT parameter panels for some procedures and XML parameter panels for the remaining.
Created help page, including detailed example.
